It is the northernmost village. The road goes from the east side of Streymoy, up to the 'bridge across the Atlantic' to Eysturoy.

value: Image:Risin and Killingin, sea stacks off Eysturoy.jpg

From just before the village on the road, there are terrific views of Risin and Killingin, huge sea stacks off the north-west coast of Eysturoy.
Note that what look like fences are not land dividers but hay hangers.
The village itself is very picturesque - no straight lines but numerous turf roofs.
There is a cafe in the village but the opening times announced could seem optimistic!
